Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Airport Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting, characters, and the central conflict surrounding the planned demolition of Ghost Town for an airport. It establishes the emotional attachment to the past versus modern progress.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Setting and Initial Conflict
sub_scenes.description: The scene introduces the comic and its central characters in a saloon, setting up contrasting views on romance and the impending threat to Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Girl from Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Revelation and Emotional Turmoil
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to the 'Ghost Town' and reveals the plan to demolish it for an airport, triggering a strong emotional reaction from the woman and setting up the central emotional conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Exit and Ghost Town Ride
Ghost Town's Past and Airport Future
Emotional Argument about Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Family Business and Romantic Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on family dynamics, business propositions related to the airport construction, and Nan's emotional conflicts regarding Cal and her father's expectations.

sub_scenes.title: Business Discussions and Family Discord
sub_scenes.description: The scene introduces business conversations around the airport and horses, juxtaposed with family tension and Nan's defiance against her father's plans.

sub_scenes.title: Maternal Comfort and Seeking Clarity
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to Nan receiving comfort and advice from her mother and maid, leading to Nan's decision to seek clarity in her relationship with Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Maid's Pragmatic View on Love and Action

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Doubts and Hesitant Confession
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal about their relationship, leading to a dismissive response followed by a surprising and hesitant confession of Cal's feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Impending Crisis
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reconcile just as a severe snowstorm hits, shifting the focus to a community-wide crisis and threat to their livelihood.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Reconciliation and Understanding
Mr. Wills and Son Assess the Snowstorm's Severity
Grave Concerns about Livestock and Fodder
Confirmation of the Weather's Unprecedented Danger
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst Hardship
Cal's Ominous Reflection on Impending Starvation and Future Uncertainty

sub_scenes.title: Community Resilience and Hope
sub_scenes.description: Despite despair, the community rallies, finding hope in external aid and reaffirming their relationship amidst the crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Doubt and Cal's Reassurance in the Face of Crisis
Nan's Mother's Plea for Rest and Hope Amidst Overwhelming Odds
Cal's Restless Night and the Unrelenting Snow
Despair and Weariness in the Face of Endless Winter
Sound of an Airplane and a Glimmer of Hope
Excitement and Realization of Fodder Drop
Conversation on Romance Amidst Crisis and Relief

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Casanova and Town Dynamics
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting and characters, focusing on Chane Benson, his reputation, and the town's varied reactions to his actions, setting up a different kind of conflict and character study.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Town Reactions
sub_scenes.description: The scene introduces Chane Benson in a dramatic town setting and showcases the immediate reactions and judgments of the townspeople regarding his behavior.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and a Town Scene
Reactions and Judgments of Bystanders on Chane Benson's Actions
Further Reactions and Cynical Commentary on Chane Benson

sub_scenes.title: Mother's Concerns and Moral Contrasts
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to a mother's perspective, revealing her concerns about violence and contrasting her moral values with the actions of Chane Benson, while also setting up a confrontation with her son, Jeff.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Flashback and Concerns About Jeff
Macho Banter and Violent Undertones between Clyde and Chane

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Worry and Clyde's Reassurance - Jeff's Situation
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her deep concern about Jeff's behavior and seeks help, while Clyde initially tries to downplay the situation before agreeing to assist, highlighting their differing approaches to Jeff's problems.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Affectionate Agreement and Future Vision
Narrator's Observation of Jeff's Absence and Town Ride
Sally Seeks Advice from Mr. Benson
Mr. Benson's Advice on Violence and Youth

Major_Arcs.title: Newspaper Article and Town Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the fallout from a newspaper article, involving Sally, Clyde (the editor), Benson, and Jeff, leading to personal and public confrontations and escalating tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Article's Outrage and Initial Reactions
sub_scenes.description: The scene begins with Sally's furious reaction to a newspaper article, followed by Clyde being questioned about it, and Sally confronting Clyde directly.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Outrage Over the Article and Initial Talk with Benson
Sally Confronts Clyde, the Editor, About the Article
Clyde's Dismissive Reaction and Sally's Criticism
Sally Seeks Benson's Guidance in Juniper

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Plan and Jeff's Interpretation
sub_scenes.description: Benson outlines his plan to use the press to expose a murderer, while Jeff reads the article and interprets its implications, anticipating violent reactions.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Reaction to the Article and Speculation on Clyde's Response
Considering Dinner with Chane and Reflecting on His Character

sub_scenes.title: Dinner, Misunderstandings, and Violence
sub_scenes.description: The dinner invitation to Chane leads to escalating tensions, misunderstandings, a forced kiss, and Sally's angry outburst, culminating in a violent confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Dinner Moonlight Conversation and Rising Tension
Immediate Aftermath and Explanations Following the Forced Kiss

sub_scenes.title: Race to Save Clyde and Town Showdown
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Jeff realize Chane's violent intentions towards Clyde, leading to a desperate race to town and Jeff's intervention to prevent a gunfight.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Danger to Clyde and Urgent Need to Go to Town
Jeff's Determined Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation in Town and Jeff's Intervention
Escalating Tensions and a Challenge to a Fistfight
Anxious Wait in the Clarion Office
Recounting the Night's Events and Newspaper Priority
Praise for Jeff and Clyde's Character and Family Values

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Intrigue and Romantic Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a ranch setting, focusing on Betsy, Steve, and ranch-related conflicts, culminating in romantic developments and resolutions amidst ranch troubles.

sub_scenes.title: New Boss and Initial Ranch Tensions
sub_scenes.description: The scene introduces Steve Daley as the new boss, creating immediate tension and setting up potential conflicts on the ranch, alongside hints of past troubles.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of the New Boss, Steve Daley

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Problems and Trip to Town
sub_scenes.description: The scene details ranch troubles, Hank's doubts about Steve, and preparations for a trip to town, setting up both business and personal errands.

narrative_arcs.title: Settling Steve In and Past Doubts
Ranch Troubles and Range War Fear
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Dress Material

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Steve's Defense
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve's departure from town is interrupted by a confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men, leading to Steve's intervention and a physical fight.

sub_scenes.title: Hank's Reprieve and Betsy's Romantic Realization
sub_scenes.description: Betsy changes her mind about firing Hank, followed by her internal romantic realization about Steve and a conversation of gratitude and anticipation.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Commitment
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve's relationship deepens as Betsy confesses her love and Steve promises to change for her, culminating in a romantic kiss.

Major_Arcs.title: Escalating Ranch Conflict and Danger
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc intensifies the ranch conflict, involving confrontations, ambushes, and escalating danger, testing Betsy and Steve's relationship and resolve.

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Threat
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges confronts Betsy, followed by Hank and his men threatening Steve, escalating tensions and foreshadowing further conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Hank and Steve's Defense
Justification for Arms and Recall of Ambush

sub_scenes.title: Moral Divide and Steve's Departure
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve's differing approaches to conflict lead to a moral disagreement, culminating in Steve's resolute departure despite Betsy's pleas.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Narration of Pursuit and Arrival at Devil's Pass

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Interlude
sub_scenes.description: At Devil's Pass, Steve faces a dangerous confrontation, juxtaposed with a romantic scene between Betsy and Steve, creating emotional contrast amidst peril.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Capture at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Fred, and Contract Deception
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to Carrie and Fred, exploring their relationship, business ambitions, and a central deception regarding the Carlton contract, leading to emotional turmoil and revelations.

sub_scenes.title: Dave's Rejection and Ranch Concerns
sub_scenes.description: The scene features Betsy rejecting Dave and transitions into ranch concerns and Curley's suspicious behavior, setting a tone of unease and interpersonal drama.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Behavior and Ranch Concerns

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Violent Escalation
sub_scenes.description: A fence dispute escalates into violence, with Curley drawing a gun and threatening Dave and Gordon's brother, highlighting rising tensions and conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Marriage Proposal Deception
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave reconcile, followed by Carrie's interaction with Fred, leading to a marriage proposal that is later revealed to be a deception, creating romantic and business conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion of Fred and Differing Opinions
Agreement to Avoid Conflict and Carrie's Reflection
Encounter with Fred Gordon and Ominous Question
Miss Bronson and Mr. Gordon's Conversation about Dave's Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Emotional Fallout
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Fred about his deception, leading to a physical altercation and emotional distress, followed by a confrontation in Carlton's office and Carrie's subsequent emotional breakdown.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Assertions in Carlton's Office

sub_scenes.title: Acceptance and Misunderstanding
sub_scenes.description: Carrie reflects on her hurt and declares separation from Dave, followed by a town encounter where misunderstandings and suppressed emotions surface.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Pride and Present Hurt with Fred
Unexpected Encounter and Cold Dismissal in Town
Concern and Defiance in the Buckboard

sub_scenes.title: Revelation and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Carrie's emotional and physical state leads to a doctor's visit, followed by Dave revealing the truth about the contract, and finally, Carrie and Fred's romantic reconciliation and kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: Father and Dave's Clarification & Carlton's Interjection
Dave's Confession and Carrie's Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Chris, Dirk, and Border Escape
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chris and Dirk, focusing on Dirk's injury, their escape plan, pursuit by the Marshal, and a complex romantic and ethical dilemma.

sub_scenes.title: Late Night Plea and Dirk's Injury
sub_scenes.description: Dirk arrives injured and seeking help from Chris, revealing he has been shot and needs immediate assistance.

narrative_arcs.title: Late Night Visitor and Urgent Plea

sub_scenes.title: Family Concern and Marshal's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's family expresses concern and his father decides to investigate, while the Marshal arrives at Chris's ranch, initiating an official inquiry.

narrative_arcs.title: Worried Kin and a Father's Decision

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Demand and Chris's Plea
sub_scenes.description: The Marshal confronts Chris and Dirk about the killing, demanding Dirk's arrest, leading to Chris's plea for mercy and a change in the Marshal's plan.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Mercy and a Change of Plans

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance confess their love amidst the crisis, followed by Rance subtly suggesting Dirk's escape and Chris deciding to help Dirk flee.

narrative_arcs.title: Duty vs. Love and a Hint of Escape
Decision to Act and Arming Dirk

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Pursuit, and Moral Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris's escape is quickly followed by pursuit and a gunfight, leading to Rance's injury and a moral conflict about leaving him behind.

sub_scenes.title: Recovery, Reconciliation, and Wedding
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers, reconciles with Chris, and proposes marriage, leading to preparations for their wedding, which is then dramatically interrupted by Dirk.
